p: Another explanation is protection against SARS-CoV-2 induced by vaccines used against other pathogens. It seems that bacillus Calmette–Guérin (BCG) vaccination could protect from COVID-19. A strong association was observed between BCG vaccination deployment and COVID-19 mortality [ 109, 110]. Countries where BCG vaccination is given at birth showed lower numbers of COVID-19 cases and deaths [ 111]. In fact, a SARS-CoV-2 envelope protein is closely related to a Mycobacterium bovis protein and BCG vaccine could induce a specific immunity against SARS-CoV-2 by targeting its essential viral envelope protein [ 112]. Moreover, the fatality rate due to COVID-19 was lower in Asian countries where Japanese encephalitis immunization is recommended compared with those were the population is not vaccinated [ 113].
